knimeNode.name: Date&Time Difference
knimeNode.shortDescription: Calculates differences between two date&time cells.

fullDescription.intro: Calculates differences between two date&time cells and appends a new column. The output can be either a duration or a selected granularity (years, months, weeks, days, hours, minutes, seconds, millis, nanos). It can be configured to use as second date&time either a second column, the execution date&time, a selected fixed date&time or the date&time contained in the previous row.

tab.name: Base column
tab.option: The first date&time column can be chosen.

tab.name: Calculate difference to
tab.option: Calculates the difference between the chosen second column and the first column. The first column will be subtracted from the second column (second column - first column).
Calculates the difference between the execution date&time and the chosen first column. The first column will be subtracted from the execution date&time (execution date&time - first column).
Calculates the difference between the chosen fixed date&time and the chosen first column. The first column will be subtracted from the fixed date&time (fixed date&time - first column).
Calculates the difference between the date&time in row n and row n-1 in the chosen column. The n-1th row will be subtracted from the nth row ( nth row - n-1th row ).

tab.name: Output options
tab.option: Calculates the difference and outputs it in the chosen granularity (years, months, weeks, days, hours, minutes, seconds, millis, or nanos).

Calculates the difference and outputs it as duration or period. If the difference between two dates is calculated, a period column will be the output, otherwise a duration column. This implies that if the difference between local or zoned date&time columns is calculated, differences of years, months, or days will be converted to hours.
The name for the new column can be chosen.

ports.outPort: Output table containing an appended column with the calculated differences.
